meanings.definition: The act of identifying too strongly with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: Her overidentifications with the character in the movie made her believe she was actually living in that world.
meanings.sent2: His overidentifications with his favorite superhero often led him to dress like them for no reason.
meanings.sent3: She took her overidentifications with the celebrity to the extreme by copying their every move.
meanings.sent4: His overidentifications with the team captain were so intense that he started to believe he was the captain.
meanings.sent5: The overidentifications with the historical figure were so deep that she began to think she had lived in that era.

meanings.definition: The process of mistakenly identifying something as being more significant or important than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: The overidentifications with the minor issue caused unnecessary stress for the team.
meanings.sent2: His overidentifications with the small mistake made him lose sight of the bigger picture.
meanings.sent3: The overidentifications with the tiny error led to a major misunderstanding among the group.
meanings.sent4: Her overidentifications with the insignificant detail made her overlook the crucial information.
meanings.sent5: The overidentifications with the trivial matter clouded his judgment and led to poor decisions.
